intro: Canthium horridum var. xanthocaulon, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences. The yellow-stemmed spurge is notable for its bright yellow stems and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
